perturbation.original_text: Each party agrees that it shall not be entitled to withhold any portion of the royalties as a reserve. Each party agrees to provide the other with all necessary withholding tax forms.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party agrees that it shall be entitled to withhold a discretionary portion of the royalties as a general reserve. Each party is not obligated to provide the other with any withholding tax forms unless specifically requested.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts established tax law and accounting principles. Companies cannot arbitrarily decide to withhold royalties without proper documentation and legal basis, and are generally required to provide withholding tax forms, especially across state or international lines. This modification introduces ambiguity and potential non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: IRS regulations on withholding taxes; Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)

perturbation.original_text: For purposes of this Agreement, the term “Intellectual Property Rights” means know-how, inventions, patents, patent rights, and registrations and applications, renewals, continuations and extensions thereof, works of authorship and art, copyrightable materials and copyrights (including, but not limited to, titles, computer code, designs, themes, objects, characters, character names, stories, dialog, catch phrases, concepts, artwork, animation, sounds, musical compositions, graphics and visual elements, audio-visual effects and methods of operation, and any related documentation), copyright registrations and applications, renewals and extensions thereof, mask works, industrial rights, trademarks, service marks, trade names, logos, trademark registrations and applications, renewals and extensions thereof, trade secrets, rights in trade dress and packaging, publicity, personality and privacy rights, rights of attribution, paternity, integrity and other similarly afforded “moral” rights, and all other forms of intellectual property and proprietary rights recognized by the U.S. laws, and other applicable foreign and international laws, treaties and conventions.
perturbation.changed_text: For purposes of this Agreement, the term “Intellectual Property Rights” may mean know-how, inventions, patents, patent rights, and registrations and applications, renewals, continuations and extensions thereof, select works of authorship and art, certain copyrightable materials and copyrights (including, but not limited to, titles, designs, themes, objects, characters, character names, stories, dialog, catch phrases, concepts, artwork, animation, sounds, musical compositions, graphics and visual elements, audio-visual effects and methods of operation, and any related documentation), copyright registrations and applications, renewals and extensions thereof, mask works, industrial rights, trademarks, service marks, trade names, logos, trademark registrations and applications, renewals and extensions thereof, trade secrets, rights in trade dress and packaging, and all other forms of intellectual property and proprietary rights recognized by the U.S. laws, and other applicable foreign and international laws, treaties and conventions.
perturbation.explanation: By including the word 'may' and removing 'publicity, personality and privacy rights, rights of attribution, paternity, integrity and other similarly afforded “moral” rights' it creates uncertainty about which specific rights are covered, directly conflicting with the comprehensive nature of standard intellectual property definitions and potentially rendering the clause unenforceable. The removal of the clause eliminates critical elements of IPR under US and international regulations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Copyright Act, Lanham Act, common law intellectual property rights

perturbation.original_text: All materials created hereunder shall be prepared by an employee-for-hire of Licensee under Licensee’s sole supervision, responsibility and monetary obligation, or, if third parties who are not employees of Licensee, including without limitation all software developers developing the Wireless Products contribute to the creation of any Fox Intellectual Property, Licensee shall obtain from such third parties a full written assignment of rights so that all right, title and interest in the Fox Intellectual Property shall vest in Fox.
perturbation.changed_text: All materials created hereunder may be prepared by an employee-for-hire of Licensee, or by contractors. if third parties who are not employees of Licensee, Licensee is encouraged to obtain a written assignment of rights so that title and interest in the Fox Intellectual Property can vest in Fox.
perturbation.explanation: This modification significantly weakens the requirement for Licensee to secure full written assignments of rights from third-party contributors. Replacing 'shall' with 'may' and adding 'Licensee is encouraged' turns a mandatory obligation into a suggestion, which conflicts with copyright law regarding ownership of intellectual property and can affect the enforceability of the copyright.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17)
